title: Deathfire Touch
body:
can you bring back the damage numbers when you mouse over it on the scoreboard, so we know how much it is doing with our items

instead of it saying 8+60% ad and 25% ap ** it used to actually show your damage **

before this patch for example it would say 8 + (78) + (33)

replies.body: Btw can someone explain to me why anyone wouldn't pick Deathfire touch instead of Thunderlord? It's supposed to deal more damage and doesnt need to attack three times right? Or did I read that wrong?

> [{quoted}](name=Nestews,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sE25HFnE,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-06-26T18:49:30.507+0000)
>
> Btw can someone explain to me why anyone wouldn't pick Deathfire touch instead of Thunderlord? It's supposed to deal more damage and doesnt need to attack three times right? Or did I read that wrong?

Thunderlord's Decree is better on bursty champions as they don't have the DoTs needed to apply Deathfire Touch consistently. This includes burst mages like Ahri and Annie, as well as assassins like Zed.

deathfire touch is better for champs who synergies with it like teemo who cant proc thunderlords on a single shroom or or rumble who wants to hit the backline apc and adc with his ult, and poke hard in lane, dft is the choice. its also better on pokers like ziggs, who want to be always throwing something in lane, although you have to have dft  on them alot to do dmg.
be ware tho, i hate throwing a rumbling E only to shortly after tower dive but to find the turret attacking me due to dft. be ware of the dot!

Although for some reason people disagree with me, I wouldn't bring it on champions with a lot of DoT or AoE, (such as {{champion:69}} ) just because its a 1 second duration as opposed to a 4 second one.
That duration is refreshed each time the dot ticks. So in practice if you have a 4 second dot you get 4 seconds of Deathfire Touch.
Deathfire just isn't that impressive on Cassiopeia anyway, not sure why someone would take it over the significant lane impact of Thunderlord's...

i feel like thunderlords is usually an attempt at lane dominance while deathfire is more for scaling or poke, a good example would be the league of legends version of a backyard bbq {{champion:63}}  or the man who puts the first 3 letters in assassin (his actual role as an adc notwithstanding ofc) {{champion:202}}
That's a pretty fair assessment, though with the absurd AD Jhin's passive gives him he'd be taking Deathfire Touch even if he didn't scale as well.

> [{quoted}](name=TFBaam,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sE25HFnE,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2016-06-26T20:44:55.963+0000)
>
> deathfire touch is better for champs who **synergies with it like teemo** who cant proc thunderlords on a single shroom or or rumble who wants to hit the backline apc and adc with his ult, and poke hard in lane, dft is the choice. its also better on pokers like ziggs, who want to be always throwing something in lane, although you have to have dft  on them alot to do dmg.
> be ware tho, i hate throwing a rumbling E only to shortly after tower dive but to find the turret attacking me due to dft. be ware of the dot!

Teemo's E DOT does not proc deathfire touch because it is not treated as a spell effect. (same reason it doesn't proc liandaries) 
If you are referring to his mushrooms , I believe one mushroom can also proc thunderlords decree (because each tic counts as spell damage) which makes TLD>DFT.

one mushroom cannot proc thunderlords however thunderlords is stupid broken on teemo. From tossing three shrooms in one spot using bounce to instant proc it, to one shroom + 1 auto + 1 q (my personal fave, causes all the rage quits) to just straight up autoing them to death, thunderlords is better imo. Of course that is due to the way i play teemo, which is as an assassin. I have seen deathfire used well on a teemo, but only once. It was a q spamming teemo, really helped him out in lane but had almost no impact late game. sure his shrooms hurt a little more but he couldnt burst someone out of existence like thunderlords can.

Another reason might be because you absolutely want to get that 45% CDR mastery - which means that you have to take something in the Cunning tree.

Also, if you're not planning to build a lot of AD or AP, the base damage of Thunderlord's is very significant.  DFT has practically none.

Deathfire touch is good for those who get ridiculous ap/ad, and/or do not burst, or those who do dots. So like Veigar, Malz, or Jhin can use it very well. Thunderlords is better for early game, Dft is better for late, as you only need ~260 ap to out damage thunderlords.

I'd argue that Veigar likes Thunderlord's if he does QWR and somehow the target is still alive. Not sure though, I think both work well on him.

I agree with Malzahar and Jhin though, DFT is also good on most mages with sustained damage (Karthus, Aurelion Sol, Cassiopeia, Anivia etc). It also has better scaling.

But thunderlords has a ~20 second cooldown, while his ult has over 60. With his window for using it so low, coupled with the fact that he can easily get past the 260 ap to out damage thunderlords even as a support... Dft seems to win out on Veigar. And with the ult being an execute the chances of anyone surviving it is slim. I once killed a Tank Riven that was at half health with it(without me doing anything else) so Thunderlords is more of a "over kill" thing...
True. Then some people might take it to get fed early. Like I said, not sure about Veigar.

Its good on lux zed ekko annie and its debatable on ahri..

I'm just gonna drop by and say it's way too underestimated on Veigar (late game 300 damage is rather good for having no cooldown or 3 hit requirement). It can even help you one shot people with ult again.
Death fire is only good on champs that have both Ap and Ad scaling
i simply dislike death fires it takes too long to get out all its damage while thunderlords always helps me in a tight spot when im just in need of extra damage.

With champions that have really continuous damage as part of their normal play (Heimer/Veigar/etc) or are based around constant poke keeping people low all the time  for the kill instead of burst (some Ez players, cho'gath, etc) having what amounts to a continuous DoT running almost all the time on your lane opponent and all the minions can net a lot more damage than thunderlords.

I mean, nothing wrong with Thunderlord's either, but there are a lot of things that can prevent the three-hit combo from going off in the fashion that you intend it to go off.

"With champions that have really continuous damage"

"Veigar"

Whut...
Some champs can proc it easily. Fizz with Lich Bane can W Q and proc it.

In addition to everyone else's comments, DFT might also be a better choice if your champ deals a lot of AoE damage as DFT can be applied constantly to as many targets as you can hit. So if you are a late game Xerath who is constantly throwing out Q's into the enemy team, DFT will do more damage over a siege than TLD.

Thunderlord's has a base damage of 10-180 (10 per lvl).  Deathfire touch has a base damage of 6 at all levels.  Therefore thunderlord's is way better on people who aren't gonna stack a lot of AP or bonus AD, and is way better on everyone in the early game.  

Thunderlord's really helps burst damage in the early/mid game. 

 Deathfire is better late game on people that build Deathcap and Jhin/Varus/Jayce.  It's also very good on people with DoTs (Malz/Swain/Brand).
Thunderlord procs on all dmg, deathfire touch only apply on spells.
I was actually wondering why it wasn't showing them either, I would really like to have that back as well.

First time using DFT and on Morgana but somehow I killed a bard with DFT and he was sitting at 30% health, idk why people don't pick it up more often

Thunderlords is crazy good on Morg though, because while ordinary DoTs don't count multiple times, ground DoTs *do* count multiple times if they stay in the area.  Q > W is a guaranteed proc on the second tick of the W, even if you don't get into AA range.

Plus, it gets you to 45 CDR, which you can't get in an 18 Ferocity build.
Deathfire should refresh whenever an ability hits a target. I think that making it like liadries in that way would make it so much more viable on other champions.
